title: Self-Directed Mathematics Learning Space Design Utilizing Social Media

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Learners utilize personal devices (BYOD) to engage in online communities and offline workshops simultaneously, performing collaborative problem-solving activities in social media-based learning spaces

learning_goals: Learners can autonomously organize and operate discussion spaces related to mathematical concepts on social media platforms.
Learners can analyze the functional affordances of learning niches (spaces) using digital tools and propose improvements.
Learners can continuously refine self-directed learning strategies through peer feedback and formative assessments.

resources: Social Media Platform Access Permissions (Naver Band, KakaoTalk Open Chat, etc.)
Learning Activity Tracking Tool (Google Sheets, etc.)
Offline workshop space and instructional materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
